subject: Public Speaking
title: The Declaration of Independence as Oratory
description: A quick win: understand The Declaration of Independence as Oratory.

hook.text: The Declaration of Independence was written to be read aloud in town squares, not just signed in a chamber.

buildup.text: Jefferson structured it like a legal argument: self-evident truths, specific grievances, then a bold conclusion.

discovery.text: When read aloud in Philadelphia, crowds cheered and tore down a statue of King George III.

twist.text: Jefferson borrowed heavily from John Locke. The ideas weren't new â€” the packaging made them revolutionary.

climax.text: The Declaration proved that how you frame an argument matters as much as the argument itself.

punchline.text: Old ideas in a new voice started a new nation.

quiz.question: How was the Declaration of Independence originally shared with the public?
